Hi, I'm Maxx

Full Stack Developer @ Casino Education Group

Pursuing Bachelor's in Computer Science & Mathematics at Northeastern University

A rising third-year student enrolled in the Honors program. I mainly study algorithms, focused on neural networks in artificial intelligence and machine learning development using Tensor. My inspiration for AI/ML came through the first neural network based computer program for chess, Alpha Zero. With interests in psychology and philosophy my goal is to bridge the gap between the humanities and computer science, bringing light to disciplines that can greatly benefit off each other in an age where the gap between subjects only seems to widen more.

July 2021 - August 2022

Creating lesson plans (example here) and exercises for subjects like Python, Algebra, Statistics, and more.

Interests

Chess

I've been playing chess since I was about 8, and it's a game I love playing to this day. Starting as the Varsity Captain of my high school team, I played competitively for our university's A-Team, with us being the Collegiate Chess League Season 4 Division 3 Champions


NEU Chess Club
Philosophy & Psychology

Why we choose to act has always been a fascinating question. I enjoy reading authors like Dostoevsky, Kesey, Jung, and more to combine moral and psychological answers to this question. I am the Chief Editor of the Ortelian Society where we discuss heterodox and classical thoughts; crucial discussions that we often ignore.

The Ortelian Society
Personal Writing

It's important to remember fundamntals ideas like "playing fair" and "being honest" are not trivial concepts and personal connections to these must be made. I like creating writings that encourage readers to make their own answers to these questions that form the bedrock of our value structure.
